inlineContent.text: The allocator to use to allocate memory for the new object. Pass
or
to use the current default allocator.

CFDictionaryRef containing the key/value pairs that are to be placed in a TXT record. Each key must be a CFStringRef and each value should be a CFDataRef or a CFStringRef. (See the discussion below for additional information about values that are CFStringRefs.) This function fails if any other data types are provided. The length of a key and its value should not exceed 255 bytes.
A CFData object containing the flattened form of
, or
if the dictionary could not be flattened. Ownership follows the
This function flattens the key/value pairs in the dictionary specified by
into a CFDataRef suitable for passing to
. Note that this function is not a general purpose function for flattening CFDictionaryRefs.
The keys in the dictionary referenced by

must be CFStringRefs and the values must be CFDataRefs. Any values that are CFStringRefs are converted to CFDataRefs representing the flattened UTF-8 bytes of the string. The types of the values are not encoded in the CFDataRefs, so any CFStringRefs that are converted to CFDataRefs remain CFDataRefs when the CFDataRef produced by this function is processed by
This function is thread safe.

abstract.text: Access network services and handle changes in network configurations. Build on abstractions of network protocols to simplify tasks such as working with BSD sockets, administering HTTP and FTP servers, and managing Bonjour services.
An opaque reference representing a CFNetService.
An opaque reference representing a CFNetServiceBrowser.
Creates an instance of a Network Service browser object.
Flags that the system passes to net service browser callbacks.
Gets the Core Foundation type identifier for the Network Service browser object.
Invalidates an instance of a Network Service browser object.
Schedules a CFNetServiceBrowser on a run loop.
Searches for domains.
Searches a domain for services of a specified type.
Stops a search for domains or services.
A structure provided when a CFNetService is associated with a callback function or when a CFNetServiceBrowser is created.
Uses TXT record data to create a dictionary.
Flattens a set of key/value pairs into a CFDataRef suitable for passing to
An opaque reference for a service monitor.
Record type specifier used to tell a service monitor the type of record changes to watch for.
Options to use when registering a service on the network.
Sets the TXT record for a CFNetService.
Error codes that may be returned by CFNetServices functions or passed to CFNetServices callback functions.
This is a synonym for `NULL`.
A reference to a CFAllocator object.
A reference to an immutable CFData object.
A reference to an immutable dictionary object.
A type for propagating an unmanaged object reference.
